cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 165 miles SE of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across western Cuba today, then passing near the Florida Keys early Tuesday before curving north-northwest along the west coast of Florida toward the Big Bend/upper Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west-central Florida coast near the Cedar Key–Tampa Bay area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch: Florida Keys from east of Craig Key to Ocean Reef and Florida Bay; West coast of Florida from Englewood northward to the Aucilla River
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning: Florida Keys from Craig Key westward to the Dry Tortugas; West coast of Florida from Flamingo to Englewood
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South Florida peninsula (including Miami-Dade), the Florida Keys, and the west coast of Florida northward to the Big Bend
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions with occasional tropical-storm-force gusts possible (sustained winds most likely below 34 kt)
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–2 ft of surge possible from Ocean Reef through Florida Bay; unlikely to exceed 3 ft at PortMiami
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain Monday night – Tuesday could produce 2–4 in., isolated 6 in., causing localized street flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible overnight Monday into Tuesday across south Florida; elevated seas and short-period swell may disrupt pilot and small-craft operations
